currentWork: Feb 20 — Explosive day. 61 new buildings (Barcelona 15, Edinburgh 13, Bruges 16, Kraków 17, + 2 one-offs). 13 cities with Place pages. Typefully API integrated. 18 social drafts created. Direct DB pipeline is a game-changer.

todaySummary.headline: 61 buildings submitted, 4 new cities live (Barcelona/Edinburgh/Bruges/Kraków), Typefully API integrated, direct DB pipeline 30x faster

sections.title: 🔥 Direct DB Pipeline
items: Eliminated Playwright browser entirely for building submissions
heroku run rails runner with heredoc → direct DB + S3 + GPT in seconds
9 buildings in 30 seconds (was ~90s/building with browser)
Scales to 600+ buildings per run
S3 direct upload from VPS via boto3 (new pattern for Nathan’s photos)

sections.title: 🏛️ 4 New Cities Live
items: Barcelona: 15 buildings (IDs 1034-1057)
Edinburgh: 13 buildings (IDs 1058-1070)
Bruges: 16 buildings (IDs 1071-1086)
Kraków: 17 buildings (IDs 1087-1103)
All Place pages created with 8,000-10,000 char editorial content
visible_in_library bug fixed (77 buildings had nil value)

Dashboard Content Hub v2 with Typefully integration

architecture-helper.summary: Massive velocity day. Direct DB pipeline eliminated Playwright - 30x faster building submissions.

items.text: Direct DB pipeline live: 9 buildings in 30 seconds (was 90s/building)
4 new European cities launched: Barcelona (15), Edinburgh (13), Bruges (16), Kraków (17)
visible_in_library bug fixed - 77 buildings were hidden on Place pages
Typefully integration live - 18 drafts created, Barcelona thread already published
Daily content cron running (14:00 UTC) - auto-generates AH + CRE posts
PR #21 waiting for merge: map above tour, sticky sidebar, mobile bottom bar
Boston: 6 buildings still missing GPT analyses
Pinterest auto-posting 4x daily - 88 pins in queue (~22 days of content)
Must always set visible_in_library: true explicitly - save!(validate: false) skips defaults
X algorithm penalizes external links - rotate: 40% no link, 20% dot notation, 20% reply, 20% direct
Performance review cron runs every 3 days - checks Pinterest saves/clicks and X engagement, then adapts future content tone, format, and timing based on what performs
13 cities live, ~1105 buildings, 30 style pages, 13 PRs merged

cre-software.summary: pSEO push in progress. Buyer's guide template approved, 13 guides being generated. Category carousel redesigned.

items.text: Buyer's guide template approved - sub-agent writing all 13 category guides
Homepage carousel redesigned: bigger cards with product pills, numbered pager
Property Management guide live with 3 full reviews (Yardi, RealPage, AppFolio)
Sub-agents running: guide generation + product data enrichment
49 products have thin descriptions (<500 chars), 77 have only 1-2 feature groups
42 comparison pages queued after guides complete
Nathan: traffic = revenue. Rank first, monetize later. LinkedIn is the CRE channel.
pSEO target: 14 guides + 42 comparisons + 208 products = 264 rankable URLs
208 products, 14 categories, 100% enriched, SSL live

plotzy.summary: Data acquisition strong. 10 cities, 120K zones. Zoning lookup could be a killer feature.

items.text: 10 cities acquired with ~120K zones, 566 MB total zoning data
Pipeline script: acquire.py with pagination, batch mode, point-in-polygon testing
Wave 1 next: Washington DC, Philadelphia, Boston
Nathan offered financial position context - advised broad strokes only for security
CRE OpenClaw SaaS plan: $99-799/mo tiers, Plotzy zoning data as moat
County assessor + ArcGIS zoning + municipal code = complete property zoning lookup from public sources
Houston has no zoning law. San Antonio too large (733K). Several cities lack public ArcGIS.
Potential killer feature: enter address → instant zone + ordinance meaning
CA: LA/Sacramento/SF | TX: Austin/Dallas | FL: Tampa/Miami-Dade/Orlando/Ft Lauderdale | OK: Norman
